C2 a smell, often one that is unpleasant: Inside the room there was the unmistakable odour of sweaty feet. Aroma preference is largely influenced by our body odour. Synonyms

pong UK informal humorous

odour noun [C or U]
(quality)
literary a particular quality that can be noticed: The odour of hypocrisy hung about everything she said. Lieberman said the article had an odour of anti-Semitism.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has an odour of sanctity about him.There's something too worthy about them - an odour of the New Woman.This is one of the most vigorous and progressive corners of the labor movement - and yet it somehow carries the odour of a fading religious sect.
